4. Mayor Jane Hughson

Mayor Jane Hughson
==================

Contact Information
-------------------

### Jane Hughson - Mayor

630 E Hopkins  
San Marcos, TX 78666  
Cell Phone: 512-781-8538  
**To Schedule an Appointment or Event, Please call: 512-393-8088**  
[Email Jane Hughson](mailto:jhughson@sanmarcostx.gov)   
[Email City Council](mailto:councilmembers@sanmarcostx.gov)

Terms in Office
---------------

* 2024-2026
* 2022-2024
* 2020-2022
* 2018 to 2020
* Previously served in Place 4: 2014 to 2018; Place 3: 1996 to 1999; 1999 to 2002

![Mayor Jane Hughson Portrait](https://www.sanmarcostx.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentID=22135 "Mayor Jane Hughson Portrait")

**Jane Hughson** was elected as Mayor of San Marcos on November 6, 2018, re-elected November 3, 2020, November 8, 2022, and November 5, 2024. She was previously elected to the San Marcos City Council on November 4, 2014, for a three-year term in Place 4, re-elected for a three-year term on November 7, 2017, and also served on City Council from May 1996 to May 2002.

Mayor Hughson is a long-time San Marcos resident and a Southwest Texas State University graduate. Â  She retired from Texas State University after 33 years of service.

Currently, Ms. Hughson serves as a member of the Capital Area Council of Governments ([CAPCOG](https://www.capcog.org/)) Executive Committee and the Capital Area Emergency Communications District Board of Managers. She also serves on the following policy committees: Economic Development Advisory Committee, Capital Area Regional Transportation Planning Organization, Central Texas Clean Air Coalition.

She is a member of the boards of the [Alliance Regional Water Authority](http://alliancewater.org/), [Hays Central Appraisal District](https://www.hayscad.com/) and the [Hays Caldwell Economic Develop Partnership](https://www.hayscaldwelledp.com/).

She has been a member of several City of San Marcos committees, boards, and commissions, including chair of the Comprehensive Plan Citizen Advisory Committee 2023, vice chair of the Planning and Zoning Commission, chair of the Transportation Advisory Board, chair of the Emergency Medical Services board, and a board member of the Convention and Visitorâ€™s Bureau, the Charter Review Commission, and the Ethics Review Commission.

She has served as president of the Heritage Association of San Marcos, Leadership San Marcos, the Hays County Area Food Bank, and the Friends of the San Marcos Cemetery. Other organizations of which she is a member are: League of Women Voters, Womenâ€™s Political Caucus, San Marcos Chamber of Commerce, and the Upper San Marcos Water Initiative.

She was appointed by the Texas Legislature to the first Edwards Aquifer Authority board where she served as chair of the administrative committee.

In addition, she is a graduate of the San Marcos Citizens Police and Fire Academies. She also personally sponsors a youth baseball team each year in memory of her father, C.C. "Tex" Hughson.

Mayor Hughson advocates for preservation of our city's neighborhoods, the preservation of the City's natural resources, and economic development.
